result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shayne D McKenzie

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shayne D McKenzie in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Stayed warrant is vacated. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned for a Calendar Call to Br 16.  Calendar call scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court via zoom, defendant Shayne D McKenzie not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared on behalf of Annie Louk for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Further, defense is requesting an additional Status Conference date to check on revocation status. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shayne D McKenzie in court, defendant in custody. Attorney Connor Romenesko appear by video.  Najot Hira in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Marquette Poilce Officer A Huber. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/28/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Shayne D McKenzie in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/26/2022 @ 01:00pm
